algorithm_technique: Coordinate mapping and string manipulation to build path
problem_summary_simple: Find the shortest sequence of moves on an alphabet board to spell a target word.
problem_summary_technical: Maps characters to 2D coordinates on a board, calculates Manhattan distance for moves, and constructs the path string.
key_insights: The board layout allows for direct mapping of characters to (row, column) coordinates.
The problem can be solved by calculating the difference in coordinates between consecutive characters.
The order of moves (U/D before L/R) doesn't affect the minimum number of moves, but affects the path string.
